intro: Ocampoa stenopetala, commonly known as the narrow-petalled ocampoa, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and has slender, hairy stems. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Ocampoa stenopetala is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
